# Overview 
This is the analysis of white matter dsi studio connectometry for Maze and Loop 

# <span style="color: darkblue;">Methods </span> 
##### **Participants** 
* Total number of scans = 120 (males and females )
  * Total scans used in analysis= 118 
  *Exclude subs 329 and 372 from analyses
        
##### **Scan parameters** 
* Locations from UCSB and UCI

##### **QSIprep** 
* Version used: 0.16.0RC3
* The following parameters were used
  * dwi_denoise_window **5** 
  * hmc_model **3dSHORE** 
  * hmc-transform **Rigid** 
  * shoreline_iters **2**

### **DSI Studio**
*Version and tags used 
  * **chen-2022-07-31**

##### **Correlational connectometry**

###### **Parameters** 
* T-threshold = 2.5
* Length = 25
* Permutation = 4,000
* pruning 4
* non normalized QA

#### **Analyses and Final sample sizes ** 

##### **Exclusions** 
* 347 was excluded due to low quality out liar in DSI 

##### Maze Accuracy and Path Efficiency {.tabset} 
###### N
* All subjects = 82
* Men = 22
* Women = 60
* Stage
  * Pre = 23
  * Peri = 20 
  * Post = 17

##### Loop: Position Error, Degree Error, Angular Error  {.tabset} 
######  Rad 3
* some subjects removed becuase they did not have rad3 score
* All subjects = 38
* Men = 14
* Women = 24
* Stage
  * Pre = 10
  * Peri = 7
  * Post = 7

###### Average
* All subjects = 42
* Men = 17
* Women = 25
* Stage
  * Pre = 23
  * Peri = 20 
  * Post = 17

# <span style="color: darkorange;"> Maze Accuracy </span>  {.tabset .tabset-dropdown}

## QA {.tabset}
### Summary of results 
There were both positive and negative correlations between QA and maze performance when all subjects were included in the analysis. When men were analyzed separately, men men displayed more negatively associated correlations between QA and maze performance. Women displayed tracts with predominantly positive correlations between QA and performance. When split by menopause stagge, Pre and post displayed both positive and negative correlations while peri displayed only positive correlations with performance.

<!---------------------------------------MD Accuracy--------------------------------  -->

## MD {.tabset}
### Summary of results 
DSI was run on all subejcts, with sex and age listed as covariates. There were positive correlations between MD values in the Fornix (L&R) and performance. Using a sex straisfied apporoach we viewed the relationship between white matter and performanc ein men and women seperately. Men, displayed a majortiy of positive correlations between tracts with MD and accuracy. Specifically in regions associated with navigation such as the fornix (L & R).  Women, displayed a majortiy of negative correlations between tracts with MD and accuracy. Specifically in regions associated with navigation such as the fornix (L & R), and cerebelllum. We then investigated the relationship of white matter and performance when splitting by menopause stage. Pre menopause women displayed a majortiy of negative correlations between tracts with MD and accuracy in the fornix(L&R) and corpus callosum. Peri menopause women displayed a majority of positive correlations between tracts with MD and accuracy in the fornix(L&R) cerebellum and cingulum. Post Menopause displayed both positive and negative relationships between MD and  performance. The majority of tracts with positive correlations were in the fornix, while a majority of the negative correlations were found in tracts in the parietal cortex and cerebellum.
